page.title: 08HUDDERSFIELD-PENISTONE RLY.
page.content: The Huddersfield to Penistone railway line is a prominant feature of our 'D block'. It enters it from the North in the outskirts of Huddersfield near the former Berry Brow station. Robin Hood and Honley tunnels bring the line to Honley station, overlooking the High School. Climbing on a gradient of 1 in 100 the next station is reached after 1.5Km at Brockholes. This attractive station has featured in the BBC comedy series, "Last of the Summer Wine". Immediately South of the station, at the point where the line leaves the 'D block', is the junction of the long abandoned Holmfirth branch. The main line, opened in 1850, has itself been under threat of closure since 1963. Few passengers now use the stations which have been unmanned halts since 1961.
